titleInfo.title: Nathaniel F. Harrison, Jr. oral history interview

subject.geographic: Mount Zion First Baptist Church (Baton Rouge, La.)

mods.abstract: Harrison discusses many aspects of Mount Zion Baptist Church in Baton Rouge, including the church's history, demographics, ministries and services, role in the community, efforts to work with troubled youth and elderly parishioners, and the changing role of the church in people's lives. He describes his personal involvement in the church and work with Reverend Theodore J. Jemison.
mods.note: This collection includes materials accessioned as Mss. 4700.0866; A digital version of the transcript (pdf) exists for duplication purposes; A digital version of the audio recording (mp3) exists for duplication purposes and public access in the Special Collections Reading Room; Interview conducted by Tonetta Morrison.

Nathaniel Harrison, Jr. was born in Houma, La., in 1950. He moved to Baton Rouge in 1965 to live with his uncle, Nicholas, a deacon at Mount Zion Baptist Church. Harrison received a B.S. and Master's degree from Southern University and spent his career at Southern working in various administrative positions. He has served in many capacities at Mount Zion Baptist Church, most recently as a church officer.

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.). T. Harry Williams Center for Oral History
